Reviews.Content: Luxury Hotel in a Great Locations       2 shwoers left and right side
Reviews.Author: moximo

Reviews.Content: Top notch service       The bathroom
Reviews.Author: Hatter2004

Reviews.Content: My home in Paris We keep returning to the Sofitel Arc de Triomphe and it just gets better. We first stayed here in the 1970's with our small children when it was called the Windsor-Reynolds, so it has many memories for us. Under the Sofitel brand it is just fabulous. We feel that we are home when we arrive at Rue Beaujon. The rooms and baths are clean and very comfortable, the dining room and bar very cosmopolitan, and the exterior with its flower boxes retains Parisian charm.
Reviews.Author: prmco

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this lovely hotel I stayed at this hotel over a weekend , there were 20 people in our party and on arrival the staff dealt very quickly with check-in .Our room was a suite on the first floor and was large with a view of the road but you couldn't see much from the window as there was a large window box full of geraniums .The room was very well maintained and had a large flat screen tv with lots of channels to keep everyone happy , it had the best bed i have ever slept in and this was the general feeling of everyone in our party they had mattress toppers on them and it was like a cocoon so cosy and comfie .The bar was very nice and the service was very good (not so great when we arrived back from our evening out at 1am the barman was very grumpy)The concierge was also very rude as due to a language break down he booked us into a restaurant we didn't want and got very stroppy when we wanted to go to a different one and refused to get us 5 taxis to take us where we actually wanted to go, he did eventually relent and book us taxis the cost of which varied greatly between 12 euros and 23 euros depending on whether the driver took the scenic route or not.Breakfast was ok just the usual continental style the staff did seem a bit disorganized and only cleared tables when they had guests coming in to eat which meant you had to wait in the bar for a table to be cleared. The restaurant is not that big so there was often a queue.The hotel is conveniently situated for the Arc De Triomphe and other main Paris attractions . We went on a boat trip down the Seine using the Batobus but it is hop on hop off so if you want a non stoptrip i would suggest using the alternative boat trips .We also went to the Moulin Rouge which was very good .Paris was very busy with tourists but we found taxis and restaurants easy to get. It was a great trip and wish it had been longer than 3 days but maybe next time, I would definitely use the Sofitel again if only for the amazing beds
Reviews.Author: LIZcc

Reviews.Content: Sofitel failed We booked one night, confirmed our arrival the night before and once we got to the hotel, WE WERE TURNED AWAY. They claimed a leak in the bathroom of our room. No available rooms left. They direct us to another hotel close by. A BIG disappointment. We wanted to stay at the Sofitel, NOT that other hotel. Next time, we will book another place.
Reviews.Author: west32

Reviews.Content: Lived Upto Expectations Booked the hotel for our wedding anniversary and it was fantastic.The location is as good as it gets, two minutes to the arc di triomphe and to the nearest metro station and even less to the champs elysees!!.The hotel itself is very plush and we recieved an upgrade to the delux room when we checked in. The room is a good size and the bed as my wife says, is the most comfortable bed in the world!!!. The room had a LCD TV with Free internet and even UK Tv channels.The staff at the hotel were brilliant and nothing was too much trouble and they were very knowledgable about all the tourist attractions.The breakfast was a cold buffet ( apart from the warm toast and tea) but it was excellent and just what you needed to set you up for the day.Overall the cost of our stay was expensive, but worth every penny as you can not fault the excellent location and the very helpful staff and I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants a treat their loved ones to a special stay in Paris.
Reviews.Author: liverpoofan

Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay in a truely French Hotel We stayed at this hotel for my Dad's 60th Birthday and found the location terrific - less than 5 minute walk to the Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe, and about 25 to the Eiffell Tower. We arrived on a very hot Saturady afternoon by taxi from the airport ( I think we were ripped off as it cost 75 euros, and only 45 on the way back so don't get tauted like us) and found the hotel to be charming. The lobby was lovely and cool and the staff very friendly. Myself and my husband and my parents were allocated our rooms promptly but my brothers room wouldn't be ready until later on, it was already nearly 2pm at this point and he was rather disappointed he didn't have his own room in which to freshen up and put his things.Having been to the New York and Chicago Sofitels I was expecting great things and was slightly disappointed. There were all the trademark Sofitel touches; very comfortable beds, water in the room each night, lovely bar area, freindly staff, but it just didn't quite match the exquisitness of the others.The rooms were smaller, and didn't provide an iron or ironing board, the fridge was barely cool and the bathroom was well below prr compared to the others I have been to.Overal it was a nice hotel in a good location, and perhaps my negativity about the rooms is something that the hotel just can't overcome because of the building it is in, and I was perhaps expecting too much. Would I stay there again? Possibly, but I would need to take out a second mortgage - one round of drinks in the bar for 5 people cost 60 euros!!
Reviews.Author: gemstone_8

Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel in perfect location We stayed 3 nights in Paris for our first wedding anniversary and wow, all I can say, Sofitel Arc De Triomphe made it a truly amazing stay. The staff were very warm and friendly, the bed room were a good size for Paris, with luxurious bed and pillows, and the bathroom also a good size and very clean. Our room was cleaned and made up twice a day, and we even received free bottled water every day, which came in handy as mineral water is expensive in Paris. I work in the industry myself and tend to look at every aspect of a hotel and I was definitely impressed. Location is superb, and only a few minutes walk to Champs Elysee - Arc de Triomphe, and there were loads of fine restuarants by the hotel. The Sofitel Arc De Triomphe is an excellent hotel set within a typical Parisian building which makes it all the more special. And yes there are loads of cheaper hotels in Paris but you are getting your money's worth here, and I will definitely recommend it to families, friends and colleagues.
Reviews.Author: SoGlamSM

Reviews.Content: Secluded yet centrally located The Good: - The hotel is located within minutes of the Champs Elysees the Arc de Triomphe and the metro and yet on a quiet street unlike some more prominent hotels. The lobby has a welcoming look with a bar just off the reception area that serves drinks and light snacks from early morning till late in the night. The staff is friendly and responsive with most if not all speaking fluent English besides other European languages. The rooms all have excellent wi-fi (or cable connected) internet service (free) and reasonably comfortable beds. The breakfast room serves up a sumptuous full breakfast and doubles as a fine dining restaurant for dinner with reasonably good value for money.The not-so-good:- Only two small elevators that are quite slow - especially if your room is on the 5th floor or up. Bathrooms are small with an absurdly high bathtub with a shower within that is shielded by a half glass. When taking a shower count on the water spilling on to the bathroom floor. The high tub is a challenge for short and/or older folks to get into. No drawers for laying out clothes if you're inclined to not live out of a suitcase other than two hard to reach shelves in the closets. Overall a good hotel and reasonable value for money - probably better for business people than the leisure traveler.
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy

Reviews.Content: Gem of a Hotel So many wonderful things have been said about this hotel that any glowing comments I have, have already been said. I can only attest to the accuracy of previous comments that have praised this hotel.One of the benefits of this hotel for me is its proximity to Taillevent restaurant. It is one block away. This is one of the greatest restaurants in the world, and though costly, should be enjoyed in Paris if you want that special meal. By staying in the hotel and booking the restaurant, you can be guaranteed a wonderful stay in Paris.
Reviews.Author: BornTraveler

Reviews.Content: Paris Proposal My newly minted fiancee and I stayed here for three nights and it could not have been better. The room was huge for Paris standards and our room was always cleaned and neat when we got in from a long day of sightseeing. Our bathroom, however, had the shower head on the side wall of the bathtub, which was a little inconvenient and messy, but wasn't a big issue at all. The service was outstanding, I proposed to my girlfriend on the street next to the hotel and the staff had two glasses of champagne waiting for our return at the little bar. It was absolutely amazing. The location was perfect, we could walk to all the major sights (except for the Cathedral of Notre Dame) without a problem. AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: shulax28

Reviews.Content: 2nd Time- just as awesome as the first       Sofitel
Reviews.Author: WeLuv2Travel2

Reviews.Content: Terrific Sofitel I tend to think of Sofitels as high end modern business hotels; high standard, but lacking in character. This one however is an exception, and all the better for it. Location is ideal, in a quiet street but 5 mins from Etoile and just a bit further to Place des Ternes. There's a good selection of local restaurants nearby. The building itself is a nicely renovated 19th century typical Parisian building. Rooms are a decent size without being huge. Certainly my room do not show any signs of the shabbiness referred to by one other reviewer. The air con did not seem to be working that well, but the temperature was still OK so not a big issue. It seems expensive, but casting around for my next trip I'm coming to the conclusion that it's just a reflection of the price you have to pay, especially in this location. It's way better than the similiarly - priced Sofitel Champs Elysees.
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads

Reviews.Content: Loved the proximity to Arc De Triomphe Since my husband and I went for our honeymoon, he had contacted the hotel directly and made the reservations. They were extremely friendly from the start and even offered suggestions to my husband for the type of room. We got the Deluxe room with the King size bed and I must say, I was surprised by the room size. It was far bigger than any of the rooms that I have stayed in the US. The room had a seperate coat closet, a small reception like area for receiving room service, a huge bathroom with vanity area, bathtub and a shower stall. The room, in addition to the king size bed had a table with chair, a big sofa with a coffee table, a flat screen TV with DVD player, a CD player with some classic musical CDs and a blacony with the view of the top of the eiffel tower. The staff were very friendly, taught us some phrases to get around the city, showed us the way to the train stations and suggested places to see. They also made our reservations for the various shows and a visit to the Versailles. I must mention the vast array of food they had for breakfast...A good variety of meats, juices, fresh fruits, pastries and breads that one would be stuffed past lunch time. There was also a live piano concert in the bar in the evenings. Arc De Triomphe was just a 5 minute walk away. The Lido was also a 5 minute walk away. I would definitely choose this hotel for my next stay in Paris and I woud recommend others to check it out. Did I mention that they welcome your stay with some specially made chocolates and have a very nice book that you can take back home as a souvenir from your trip?
Reviews.Author: Pandora_1981

Reviews.Content: Sweet dreams at Sofitel Our stay at the Sofitel Arc de Triomphe was perfect. My husband surprised me with a weekend away for my birthday, and I cannot praise this hotel enough.From the friendly welcome when we checked in, to the helpful concierge, nothing was too much trouble for the staff here.The room was small but the bed was the most comfortable i've ever slept in!!! The bathroom was clean and well-equipped, which is a big thing for me!!!There was a sound system and flat screen tv too.Breakfast was well prepared and with good choice - something for everyone, from cereal and eggs, to fruit and pastries, and freshly-squeezed juices too.Overall we were really impressed with the Sofitel, would not hesitate to recommend it and would definitely stay again. what a find!!!
Reviews.Author: User0910

Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable Stayed 3 nights and very much enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect and we had no problem finding our way around Paris. The staff were very helpful with directions and bookings. The room was a bit on the small side but was spotless and the bed very comfortable. Had one light meal in the bar and found the food to be very good, drinks were a bit expensive but I think that is the case in most of Paris. Didn't have breakfast, at 鈧?7 pp it was a bit on the high side and we found plenty of place close by to eat.Overall we had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel.
Reviews.Author: SORIreland

Reviews.Content: Absolutely Wonderful Four of us booked a package thru Costco for air/hotel to Paris for 9 nights. One of the Costco choices was Sofitel Arc de Triumph.I can sum up in one word our experience at this hotel: Perfect.When I travel I usually stay at Marriott, Renaissance, Westin, Ritz-Carlton, etc. So, I was concerned about the quality of this hotel when I booked. I've been to Paris several times and was familar with the general location and it happens to be a prime area.From the moment we arrived we were treated royally. We had deluxe category rooms and found them to be quite lovely. Nice size for Paris standards, very clean, robe/slippers a nice touch.Breakfast buffet was included and it was wonderful. Plenty of fruits, cereals, yogurt, delicious breads/pastries, eggs, etc. Wonderful staff.Our bags were delayed a couple of days the the hotel staff went out of their way calling the airline numerous times each day to get updates for us. I can't say enough about the staff and the guest relations people. Friendliest and most helpful. Even tolerated my 2 yr old level of French and never laughed at me.The staff and intimate nature of the hotel really made our vacation special (we were two daughters (early 50's) traveling with our two moms(early 70's and quite worldly). They are still raving about the hotel and the staff.I've stayed at the Marriott on the Champs Elysees for 10 days and found the warmth and friendliness of the Sofitel to outshine the Marriott (and I'm a BIG Marriott fan). I would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: sctravelers

Reviews.Content: Superb service This was our first visit to Paris and we took the Eurostar, staying in Paris for 3 days two nights.Our hotel was excellently situated to the hotspots yet very quiet, being just off the Champs Elysees.It was also just around the corner from the Metro which is very handy if you like us are coming from Gard Du Nord.We were given an upgrade to a mini suite free of charge which always starts a trip off well!The staff at reception were extremely friendly and helpful, even when we made mistakes in our basic french!All the staff spoke English although we did try speaking French as it is considered polite to at least try.The breakfast which was included in our rate was ample and had American and French selections.The staff here were a little brusque but still amiable.They were constantly ensuring there was enough of everything and were attentive to detail.We had to ask about where to eat and the concierge was very helpful, taking time to check our various restaurants and arrange a booking.Our suite was very clean and the beds were divine! Best bed I have slept in - Deep mattress, sumptous pillows and duvet.There was ample refreshment in the room, replaced each day.Best of all, really nice freebies in the bathroom and complimentary bathrobes and slippers ( we didn't take those!)Overall, this made the whole trip away for just the two of us without the children, a relaxing, luxurious experience.Having never visited Paris, we were pleased to have made a good choice here. It also rates 98th out of 2000 hotels in Paris.
Reviews.Author: mainemidge

Reviews.Content: Great escape Great room, the best bed we've ever slept in, excellent service and wonderful location. Great food in both the restaurant and the bar. I'll be back!
Reviews.Author: mirasmor

Reviews.Content: Unique-Romantic Place Absolutetly a pleasant stay.Wonderful staff and unicque place for a romantic trip.
Reviews.Author: tommyoaks

Reviews.Content: Very nice, but... This is a lovely hotel near the Arc De Triomphe and we had a very nice stay in Nov 2007. The good: nice sized room, nice staff, teddy bear on the pillow, turn down service each night with a nice note, they gave us a a nice bottle of wine since it was our anniversary and it was a quick walk to and from the Air France Les Cars airport shuttle buses. We loved the bed that has been the subject of many reviews. Yes, it is simply a mattress with a down feather topper, but we found it very comfortable. The AC/Heat worked very well. The room was quiet and relaxing. The bathroom was very nice.The not so good was simply the location. Not that it was in a bad part of town, but if you are visiting Paris as tourist you will soon find out, that most of the City sites are not nearby. This area is a business district and this seems to be mostly a business hotel. The area is quiet at night even through is it close to the Champs Elysees. We always felt safe walking to the hotel but would have preferred a few more people on the local streets at night. The Metro was about a 5 minute walk away and we used it extensively to get around the City. We did not eat at the hotel. There a plenty of places to eat everywhere in the City and the price for breakfast seemed high.If you need a great bed, a very good room and want to stay near the Champs Elysees, I would recommend staying here. If there is a next time visit to Paris for us, we would stay somewhere in the Left Bank.Regardless of where you stay, go to Paris, you will enjoy a great city!
Reviews.Author: cpape

Reviews.Content: Upscale version of a substantard Paris hotel.... Just got back from a 4 nights stay at this hotel and I have to say i was not 100% satisfied.The good : the staff is really great,very polite and professional,everyone is ready to help you.We had a bottle of red wine waiting for us in the room.Location cannot be beat,you are at 5 min walk to Champs Elysee and about 15 minutes to the Tower.Breakfast buffet is very good but very pricey (29 Euro per person)The bad : room.The rooms and the corridors in general are very worn and tired. The lady at the front desk kept for us the nicest rooms in the hotel (her words). The room was yes big,with a nice balcony too,but really very shabby. They even provide you a CD player with some CD,but ours was not working.And then the bed. I'm a mattress freak,I choose hotels based on their mattress's opinions. This hotel was promising a very comfy bed based on what I've read on tripadvisor. Well....the Mybed from sofitel was a total joke. It is basically a rock hard mattress with a featherbed pillowtop all enveloped in a sheet,and then you have another duvet on top. Man ...it was hot and very uncomfy..i missed my Tempur so much...The bathroon was huge.with tow showers,vey clean but very old styled.All in all it was not a bad stay,but again,the rooms are really showing some age.
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet

Reviews.Content: Great Stay...Great Anniversary       View from the Cafe de Trocadero
Reviews.Author: Shawn08

Reviews.Content: Loved the Sofitel Fantastic location 500 Yards from Arc De Triumphe  500 yards from The Champs Elysee.The staff were friendly and very helpful.Excellent breakfast and large beauftiful rooms We had a de-luxeWould recommend Chez Catherine a restaurant 3 minutes from hotel delicious food quite reasonable. Also Laudee on Champs Elysee. Would stay here again if returning to Paris.
Reviews.Author: paulinepum

Reviews.Content: Extremely Positive Experience This was a great hotel for our first trip to Paris (we are from the U.S.). The hotel is in an excellent location. Walking distance to many famous sites but the fact that the hotel is a couple of blocks off the major streets means that the street noise is minimal to nonexistent. Easy access to the metro system. The hotel has excellent curb appeal, a very nice lobby, and the greeting was quite friendly and professional. No real language barrier as all the staff (front desk, concierge, bellmen )spoke English quite well.  Our room was nothing short of great. Handsome, understated French decor (not the Louis XIV style we had seen in some T. A. photos). Tasteful prints on the wall, flat screen TV with free internet access, and exceedingly comfortable bedding/ linens (nice!). Our daughter had a comfortable roll away bed. The room was plenty big for the three of us. Great bathroom with separate room with commode. Excellent bath and shower products. The room safe was a little balky but they have a safe deposit at the front desk as a back up. Breakfast came with our package. It was very nice and relaxing. Hot and cold foods and very good coffee. Juices, bottled waters, fruit, pastries, etc. There are so many great places to eat is was hard to stay at the hotel for breakfast but we did and we enjoyed it. Free newspapers to include an international version of USA today (for those of us not interested in reading about soccer and cricket while in Europe). We very much enjoyed a dinner at Le Florimond Restaurant on 19 av. de la Motte- Picquet (on the left bank- a short cab ride). The owner- Pascal- is great. He is very friendly and went over the entire menu for us in English. Great food and wine- a memorable dinner in Paris. I would definitely return to this hotel again and would highly recommend it to others. I personally had a bias about traveling to Paris (had heard all the negative comments about tourists being treated poorly) but was completely impressed with how well we were treated everywhere and particularly at our hotel.
Reviews.Author: Anrmd

Reviews.Content: Superb little hotel, definitely 5* Fabulous little hotel with great location barely 5 min walk to Champs Elyees and tube station. Very friendly efficient staff. I had taken my partner for his b'day and the concierge reccomended a great seafood restaurant for dinner - Chez Clement on Avenue Wagram. We had an excellent evening. The hotel also gave us a weather forecast the evening before as it was forecast to rain the next day - I thought that was very thoughtful on their part. Rooms are excellent, on the smaller side but a to-die-for bed, well stocked minibar, large flatscreen tv and scrupulously clean. Only downside is the breakfast which is 28 EUR pp. But since Champs Elyees is so close, I would reccomend walking around for an inexpensive Parisian cafe breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: sukrita

Reviews.Content: luxurious stay We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon. When we checked in, we learned that we had been upgraded to a junior suite. Since we had made our reservation through priceline and had not paid very much, we were delighted.The room was luxurious and spacious. The heavenly bed was the most comfortable bed we had ever slept in! We enjoyed the large bathroom and CD player on our night-table.The staff seemed busy and rushed, but since we were only there for one night, we didn't mind.The location, near the Arc de Trimphe and right off of the Champs Elysse was fantastic.
Reviews.Author: caren921

Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with heavenly bed! This is the first time I book a Sofitel hotel and it will not be my last. The staff was OUTSTANDING, they absolutely couldn't be more helpful. The room was nicely furnished and was filled with little touches that were wonderful( a bottle of wine...a bottle of perfume...a teddybear for my son....etc). The bed was fantastic, it was the most comfortable mattress I have ever tried. The hotel is situated a 5 minute walk from the Arche de Triomphe, and with the metro that is also close, it makes visiting Paris a breeze. I will definitely give Sofitel another try in the future....this hotel was a wonderful experience.
Reviews.Author: ZacmanMontreal

Reviews.Content: A Nice Hotel I have used this website before for checking on hotels i wanted to book and found it very useful so thought i would return the favour!! just got back from beautiful paris and a lovely stay at this hotel. We were really looking forward to going after reading the reviews and looking at the photos, i have to say i was very slightly disappointed. The room was tiny!! the bathroom was also very small and had tiles falling off the wall!! I got a really good deal when booking this hotel so didnt pay full price, i think if i had have paid full price i would have been very disappointed. On the plus side the location is great and the hotel itself is beautiful, the beds are amazing and the turn down service with a teddy bear on the pillow was a very nice touch. Overall i would like to stay here again but maybe next time ask for a larger room!!!
Reviews.Author: joetash13

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Amazing !!We booked this hotel for our honeymoon and couldn't have chosen better!! The location was perfect 2 mins from Arc De Triomphe,.Rooms fantastic.. Feather beds to die for which does make it tricky to get up.Staff very friendly and all spoke english ..Lovely Lovely !! this hotel went towards making our honeymoon perfect. Thank you Sofitel.
Reviews.Author: mupp3t

Reviews.Content: Good hotel in great location After problems booking via the hotel website, we eventually got a good BB deal with this hotel. It's a good hotel with good staff  is situated in a great location. It's 5 minutes walk from the Champs d'Elysees / Arc de Triomphe / 2 metro stations  15 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower.We got a great room with plenty of space for a double  single bed. That said the bathroom was tiny  we could easily hear our neighbours talking. The breakfast was a typical continental buffet. Avoid the scrambled eggs at all costs.Overall, good hotel  would recommend it. Beware of the conmen  their wedding ring scam on nearby streets. We were approached on 2 of the 3 mornings as we left the hotel on our way to the metro stations.
Reviews.Author: Pigsick

Reviews.Content: heavenly       Room
Reviews.Author: snowdrop1008

Reviews.Content: Fab location, great staff, excellent value We booked this hotel online using Expedia and got what appeared to be a good deal on the rate. Upon arrival at the hotel we discovered just how good the deal was, this hotel is a definite 4* and the rack rate displayed on the door showed this.The staff were friendly, spoke excellent English and were very helpful throughout the stay. As breakfast wasn't included we decided not to eat at the hotel during our stay. The breakfast was an additional E28 each. Which we thought was excessive. We stayed in room 119 on the first floor, the room looked out over the street but we were not disturbed by noise during the stay, the hotel is off the main thoroughfare and was very peaceful. The room was clean and offered the usual toiletries, well stocked mini bar along with free Wi-fi internet and CD player. The bathroom was a good size and the shower was quite powerful. The bed was very soft, due to the duvet on the base of the bed, used as a sheet. However it was VERY hot during the night, we put the air conditioning on to very low and we were still extremely hot during the night. It was a mild night but I can't imagine what it would be like in August! Perhaps the hotel could offer sheets rather than duvets in summer? We would stay at this hotel again in Paris, it is ideally located near the George V metro station and all the sights. Recommended.
Reviews.Author: boozle

Reviews.Content: Great spot in Paris Had a great 6 night stay at the hotel (married couple in 30s). Room was wonderful with a view (distant) of the Eiffel tower. Location was perfect with easy access to the Champs d' Elysees and multiple metro stops. Staff was very helpful - they fixed our safe within minutes, recommended some great restaurants and sites, as well as got us into some restaurants we had trouble getting into on our own. Room service and dining is somewhat lacking - but who wants to eat in your hotel room in Paris. Would not hesitate to stay here again.
Reviews.Author: jj7654

Reviews.Content: Noisy neighbours ruined my night I was staying at the Sofitel as a guest of a company, as I was due to present for them at the George V the next morning (guess the budget didn't stretch). The hotel itself is pleasant enough with a piano bar in the lobby, but its cosy rather than impressive. The room wasn't massive but tastefully furnished and there lots of complementary little bits waiting for me. The Sofitel chain clearly thinks its marshmallow-like beds are a USP as they let you buy the bedding but I found the huge pillows too soft. Worse was to come after lights out. The next room seemed oblivious to the noise they were causing playing music, talking loudly, opening and closing doors, etc.After about 40 minutes I'd had enough and called reception. They promptly agreed to call the room to as them to be quiet. About 3AM it started again and this time I just asked to be moved to another room - without packing up all my stuff. They sent someone up without complaint, but he didn't hand over the new room key.I went back to my room before 7AM, and they had wiped my wake up call from the TV, so it was lucky I was so on edge and sleep-deprived I didn't need it.The hotel cant be fully responsible for its insomniac guests, but the room insulation is pretty poor.
Reviews.Author: LondonGus

Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and we couldn't have had a better experience. The Junior Suite room was very large and lovely and the bathroom was quite nice and spacious for our needs. The staff was incredibly helpful - we wanted for nothing. I highly recommend this hotel for Paris visitors. It's in a great location and relatively near a Metro station. We plan to stay here again on all subsequent trips to this beautiful city.
Reviews.Author: MelissaU

Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in every regard! Pre-paid a 4 night stay at the Sofitel through their website in order to get the lowest rate. I had been to Paris before but was going with my wife who had never been and wanted a hotel within walking distance of major Paris attractions. As the name of the hotel implies, the hotel is located about 2 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and is a stone's throw away from the cheap Air France transfer bus from CDG airport. It's walkable to pretty much everything in Paris, and being in a residential neighborhood made it quiet at nights and in the mornings.I booked a deluxe king size non-smoking room and the size of the room was big by any standard, let alone Europe's. The room was very clean, and was full of many nice little extras, like free internet and a free bottle of water every morning. There was a temperamental mini-bar fridge that seemingly charged us a drink every time we just looked at it, but the front desk took it off our bill no questions asked. The only small gripe that I had about our room was the shower/tub and the half glass partition used instead of a full shower curtain or door. This seems to be the norm in Paris so I can't fault the hotel, but it did cause water to leak out onto the floor. No big deal since the bathroom was so large, it didn't matter.Of course, when talking about the Sofitel, one must gush on and on about the bed. Despite Paris being Paris, my wife and I have come back remembering that bed more than anything else...it is that good. (Or maybe my bed at home is that bad!) It is so obscenely comfortable, it makes getting out hard. It's the perfect thing when you've been walking around Paris all day carrying bottles of wine purchased from Fauchon.We ordered room service one night and the food was decent although not spectacular when considering the price. Otherwise, we ate all of our meals outside since food was better and cheaper. There's maid service during the day and then turndown service at night, so it was always nice coming home finding our bed ready every night.The last time I was in Paris I stayed at the Intercontinental, now the Westin (Place Vendome) for nearly twice the price of the Sofitel. Despite Place Vendome being a better location, the price difference and room difference will make me book the Sofitel again in a heartbeat. And adding in the fact that right next to the hotel was a BNP Paribas where I could get cash out of the ATM fee-free with my Bank of America ATM card 24 hours a day, and it's hard to find fault with the Sofitel Arc de Triomphe.
Reviews.Author: TravelBugger3

Reviews.Content: Very Comfortable And Comforting The Sofitel is primarily a business hotel, but even as tourists on a 6 night stay we found it very comfortable. The staff was very helpful in every way and personable rather than 5 star distant. The quality of the breakfast is not quite bed and breakfast standard but it was decent. The beds are extremely comfortable and after a day of walking a welcome respite. Keep an eye on the type of room, the first couple of rooms alloted were not quite up to par. One was too small for the size of bed and the other had an AC malfunction, the reception was helpful however and did get us a new room which was perfect. The location is perfect for the Air France bus from the airport and for the Champs Elysees but its hard to find a place to eat at later hours unless you opt for Champs Elysees prices. The room service menu leaves something to be desired. All in all a very good option when you want a little comfort in your stay.
Reviews.Author: shibaniwrites

Reviews.Content: Very Disappointing Stay We just returned from a long weekend in Paris and stayed at this hotel where we experienced a variety of problems. We were not only annoyed by the problems themselves but the problems were made much worse by the couldn't care-less attitude of the staff. The concierges were very helpful but the front desk staff's behavior was totally unacceptable. My husband and I have travelled extensively and been to Paris many times and have NEVER encountered such an appalling lack of customer service. 1. Although our hotel room was on a non-smoking floor, the room reeked of cigarette smoke. When we complained to the woman at the front desk, she told us that we were on a non-smoking floor. We explained that we knew that; the hallways were find but the room smelled of smoke. We asked to be moved to another room; she said she had no more rooms. We told her we didn't smoke and the smell was making it hard for us to breathe. She said she understood and then told us that the hotel had a machine that could take care of the problem but that we had to be out of the room for 3 hours. We told her that would be just fine and we agreed upon a time. When we returned to the room, we now smelled some other substance that had been sprayed/infused in the room and could still smell the cigarette smoke under that.2. Although we don't often make use of minibars, we decided on our second day to purchase something. The minibar's refrigeration wasn't working, which meant everything was room temperature. We told the front desk people who said they would look into it. It was never fixed. 3. The hotel offers a take away breakfast which is supposed to include coffee, 2 pastries and juice or fruit. It's a great idea when you are on the run...if they fill the order accurately. One morning we decided to order it as we had booked an early morning bus tour to Giverny. When we went downstairs that morning they did not have a record of the order we had placed the night before but the staff person ran back to the kitchen and came out with 2 little bags. We were in a hurry now and so didn't check the contents of the bags. Although the order form we had filled out the night before asked us to specify which pastries we wanted and whether we wanted juice or fruit, the bags we were given did not contain the pastries we had ordered nor did they contain juice or fruit. When we returned to the hotel in the late afternoon and complained to the staff person at the desk, he told us he would look into it. We never heard anything more.IF the response from any of the front desk staff had included some kind of apology or acknowledgment or simply fixing of any of these problems, our stay at the Sofitel would not have been great, but we would not have been as annoyed.and exasperated. We don't expect perfection, but we do expect customer service.We will never stay at this hotel again and probably not at any other Sofitel, either. We will probably write the Sofitel management directly to complain, as well.
Reviews.Author: kfgNYC

Reviews.Content: Great location Just returned from a weekend trip to Paris with my Mother and 5 yr old son. We booked a deluxe room with twin and rollaway bed.The room was fairly large with a good sized bathroom and overlooking the street. Although the hotel is very near the Arc de Triomphe it was incredibly quiet at night (even though we were there during the election).We ate breakfast in the restaurant on the first morning which was standard buffet style fare..but for 27euros (拢18.50) per person I thought it was exorbitant. The next morning we had coffee and croissant sent up by room service, although expensive, certainly was enough for the three of us until lunchtime and a lot cheaper than the buffet. We didn't eat dinner at the hotel as there were plenty of brasseries nearby and for young children I would recommend Bistro Romain on Champs D'Elysee.There is a small taxi rank near the back of the hotel so you don't need to pay the extra by ordering one through the concierge. (There was always 4 euros on the tab when we got into an ordered cab)The hotel staff were very good with my son and he was delighted when they gave him a bag of sweets when we were leaving. On the first night they also left a small teddy on his pillow which he was equally delighted by.The staff were efficient and we didn't have to queue or wait long for anything from check in to room service.Family friendly, efficient and reasonable value, although I would breakfast elsewhere.I will stay here again.
Reviews.Author: JuliaLondon

Reviews.Content: Wonderful, will make it a regular stay when in Paris... Wonderful hotel. Great location. Walking distance from a lot of majorattractions. Concierge Alin was excellent. Staff spoke English for us and was very warm and friendly. The room was large for European standards. We had a view of the Eifel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. We also had a small balcony. Breakfast was wonderful, the croissants were the best!! The sofitel bed was superb. My husband wanted to bring it home.Would stay here again. No worries at all. We stayed in April and it was very warm, and the air conditioning was on when we arrived to ourroom each night. The windows were very sound proof, too.
Reviews.Author: Gails2c

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with extra touches I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Arc De Triomphe hotel in Paris with my husband and 11 year old son. The Hotel is located just around the corner from the Arc de Triomphe (Hence the name!) It is well located for public transport with the air France bus from the airport dropping off nearby and easy access to the Metro.The hotel is very nice. I think we must have stayed in a regular room (No 517). The double bed was huge and so comfortable. My 11 year old had a put up/rollaway bed in the room. Our bathroom was quite small, with no separate shower and although marble and tiled, some parts looked a little tired.There were a lot of nice touches in the room - complementary bottle of wine  small perfume  each day 2 bottles of water. The beds were turned down each evening and a cute little teddy bear with 'proverb' placed on the bed! There is free Wi-fi and a cd player with selection of CDs in the room. Also the TV seems to have most terrestrial UK tv channels.The reception staff were very friendly and polite. The reception had free newspapers  apples available.We didn't use the restaurant, and for breakfast went out to one of the nearby cafes for croissants, as it was cheaper than the hotel! We did have a couple of drinks in the piano bar which was very nice.The area is full of cafes and restaurants to eat at in the evening, but this is prime tourist area so prices are inflated. We took the metro to the trendy Bastille area and had a great  much cheaper meal in that district one evening.I thoroughly recommend this hotel, it is well located, and rooms are comfortable. It's not the most luxurious hotel in the world of course, but it doesn't claim to be, nor charge those kind of prices!
Reviews.Author: ABCHampshireUK

Reviews.Content: Great location Stayed here for three pleasant nights this Easter. The staff were friendly, the room clean and we enjoyed a delicious meal at the hotel's restaurant on our first night. The standard double room (inc bb) cost 248 euros per night which I thought was quite a lot considering it was small, on the first floor with a dark inward facing view but this may be a reflection of Paris prices.I find it hard to be as enthusiastic as the other reviewers because I found everything entirely average (compared to a previous stay in another 4 star Sofitel) and actually expected comfort and surroundings to be a bit better.
Reviews.Author: Hawson

Reviews.Content: Thoroughly well reccomended From the moment we arrived till the moment we left, the service was fantastic. We stayed on the 6th floor (of 7) and the room was surprisingly spacious given we had been expecting the tiny hotel rooms Paris is famous for!Each evening we returned from dinner to find an evening gift, of chocolates and little teddies which I thought was a charming touch. The only (minor) complaint I would have is that television reception for some channels was very bad, as was trying to access the free internet via the television. But given that Paris has so much to see and do, this really wasn't the end of the world.
Reviews.Author: Anna81

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Service We had a nice stay at the Sofitel Arc de Triomphe. It was in a great location. The service and concierge at the hotel were outstanding. The rooms were clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Lexus32

Reviews.Content: Sofitel Arc de Triomphe Paris excellent service, would not hesitate to go back
Reviews.Author: dave_swash_2007

Reviews.Content: Excellent Service Stayed here for a long weekend with 2 young children in a Junior Suite.Staff were friendly, helpful and the service was excellent. Very accomodating of the children which is unusual in a high class hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: PhilGSolihull

Reviews.Content: Sofitel Arc de Triomphe Highly Recommended!!       7th Floor bedroom
Reviews.Author: KOinCT

Reviews.Content: Very good location Nice hotel in quiet and still very central location. My room was quite small and furniture could have been more comfortable, Bathroom very nice. Reception area has a nice bar with live music. Staff friendly and for this location I did not find a price of 鈧?230 per night too expensive. However, breakfast at 鈧?27 is rather high.
Reviews.Author: PFP

Reviews.Content: Favourably surprised Needed 1 night (Feb 9) in Paris and Priceline got Sofitel for $165. I got a small room 5th floor facing the inner circle. Although small the room was very clean with nice touches (Hi-speed internet through LCD TV, remote keyoard, 2 bathrobes, water and sparkling water complementary). I returned to the hotel around 2AM. I lost my card while dancing so a kind person was wake enough to open the door for me. AND ... the bed is nothing short of heavenly. I visited many exclusive hotels and resorts but truly this bed was exceptional. Breakfast in the morning was rich and tasty (horrible french coffee). All floors are served by one small elevators (limitations of the old building) so may be a problem (I had no problem). Staff was very helpful and welcoming. I stored the water in the mini-bar to cool it so when I arrived at night I had new bottles by the bed. Registration (at 3PM) took 5 minutes. Overall: My room was small for a couple (if they want to spend time in it) but everything else is exceptional.
Reviews.Author: Ganor

Reviews.Content: perfect for Paris 1st timers Location - great for walking and taking the Metro. Rooms - comfortable and cosy. Service - breakfast - good food, service excellent - BAR - felt very spoiled and looked after every time. We shopped around before choosing this hotel and think we got it right. Great hotel and if you like 4/5 star - you wont be dissapointed. Loved the late breakfast till 12.00 - you have all day to see the sights, have a lie in and enjoy!!
Reviews.Author: Massa

Reviews.Content: A Pleasant Weekend Break We stayed here for a weekend break in a deluxe suite on the 3rd floor. Check-in was very straightforward with friendly and helpful staff. The suite was very spacious with pleanty of nice touches although the bathroom was a little on the small size by comparison. Nicely furnished but perhaps getting a little tired.The location is quiet and upscale, a safe neighbourhood within 5 minutes walk of The Arc. Would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: Billyz11

Reviews.Content: Really Fabulous We have just spent 5 nights at the Arc de Triomphe Paris Sofitel Demeure Hotel in a King Deluxe room. I am usually a very difficult customer but was really impressed by this property. The staff were all incredibly friendly, helpful and most obliging. Both the room and bathroom were large, spacious and well appointed - and, all those rumours about the Sofitel bed are true.....I fell in love with their pillows !! The hotel has a great position within an easy 2 minute walk to the Champs Elysees. I highly recommend this wonderful hotel and hope to return soon.Paul - Johannesburg, South Africa
Reviews.Author: WANDERMAN

Reviews.Content: Superb Extremely pleasant stay over new year. Very comfortable room and plenty of space for the three of us.Super location. Super service.Wouldn't hesitate to return.
Reviews.Author: ScottishTraveller

Reviews.Content: Loved it! We stayed at his wonderful hotel for 2 nights last week and couldn't be more pleased. This was the last 2 nights after a very long trip that began in Paris 2 weeks prior. On that leg, we stayed at the # 1 recommended hotel on this site, Hotel Residence Foch, and were very disappointed with our accommodations. We decided to 鈥渞oll the dice鈥?and use Priceline and we ended up here and for less. When we arrived, we were greeted warmly and allowed to check in right away despite the early (9 am) hour. When we got to our room, we noticed the smell of paint coming from one of the rooms being renovated. When we brought this up with the front desk staff, they did not hesitate to offer to move us to another room. This room was a corner room (#515) that was just amazing. There was a separate toilet room from the full bath (comes in handy when traveling with a significant other..) huge flat screen TV, wonderfully comfortable bed, and a small balcony with a nice view of the surrounding area.Our last night there we asked the concierge for a recommendation for a good, but not break-the-bank, restaurant for dinner. They gave us many options, but strongly suggested Chez Catherine around the corner. It was superb.Many thanks for a wonderful stay and Parisian experience.
Reviews.Author: frequentravel

Reviews.Content: good location Spent three nights at the Sofitel between Christmas and New Year. We booked on a special credit card promotion but did not get our free upgrade as advertised - we were given a small room facing the back with a queen bed. The bed was very comfortable though with a feather/down mattress cover. The main problem was the noise at night from the plumbing system and the next room through the connecting door, and the very strong odour of cigarette smoke although we were on a non-smoking floor.Otherwise service was good and the best of all, breakfast was served till mid-day! Great for those who enjoy a lie-in. Location of the hotel is excellent - short walk to the Champs Elysee, the metro or the Air France bus stop to CDG.
Reviews.Author: Letstakeoff

Reviews.Content: Suite Review Recently stayed in this Hotel over the new year period. As a treat we took a suite. It was huge with spacious bathroom and separate toilet, hallway leading to huge living area with sofa, 3 tables and numerous tasteful chairs and wide-screen TV. The most beautiful curtained bed in separate room area and walkin wardrobe.I always rave about the beds in the Sofitels I have stayed in. They are just such a delight to sleep and laze in all morning. The living area also had French style doors opening onto a small balcony overlooking a residential apartment area and street / square. The staff were courteous and helpful. Room service was slightly slow but it was new years eve, and accompanied with a genuine apology for the time taken.The little extras in the room were extremely nice. The rubber duck in the bathroom / Hermes Eau De Toilette / Complimentary evian and a bottle of wine / Quality bath robes and huge fluffy towels and slippers. I also love the Roger  Gallet toiletries in the bathroom which is kept well stocked. The suites are expensive but worth the extra expense for a special occasion.The hotel has a good situation in a quite area within easy walk of the Arc de Triumph and just minutes from the Champs Elysees. The nearest Metro station is Charles de Gaulle Etoile and is also within walking distance situated below the Are de Triumph.Hotels / shops and bars are closely situated also.I just loved this hotel and will return again and next opportunity.
Reviews.Author: STEVEFR

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in great neighborhood My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights while celebrating our anniversary. Knowing the higher end hotels in Paris come at a higher rate, we did our homework when selecting this great spot. It is a real treat - small and intimate, super staff, and a great location.Our room was tiny and delightful, Roger and Gallet toiletries, a giant duvet and featherbed (we called our bed the Guimauve - the marshmallow it was so decadent and comfortable!). We had great robes, nice towels and slippers. The room service did take awhile to bring us our morning coffee, however we were never in a rush. The lobby provided a selection of french and english newspapers. The bar in the lobby often had a pianist playing for the guests as well.The only complaint I might have would be the fact that the doors slam all through the night, they are not on hinges that keep them from shutting quickly. Otherwise, it is close to walk to the Champs and easy to get to either the Charles de Galle metro or the George V metro station. Lots of little bistros and cafes close by too.
Reviews.Author: dntngal

Reviews.Content: For Sofitel - OK I like the Sofitel brand, and utilise their hotels throughout Europe. I assumed this, as one of the flagships, would meet, or even exceed, my expectation. The hotels was good, but I thought, somewhat tired. Excellent quiet location... but insist on seeing a few rooms as they vary in condition.
Reviews.Author: Podtheconsul

Reviews.Content: Loved it! Went through the hotel website to book ahead of time so saved a ton with the hot deals rate. Room was very large and clean. Very friendly people working at the hotel. Excellent housekeeping staff that went above and beyond. Good location (close to metro, Arc de triomphe and Champs d'Elysees). Would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: MelissaMN

Reviews.Content: Paris Stayed at the sofitel Aug.4-8 2006 in room 516 w/ balcony The room was very large. We are a family of 4 (Two children) . great location for nite activities. You are less then a block from the train that takes you everywhere in the city during the day. (Taxi cost about 8 e-purchase the 10 tickets in advance)You can also purchase your louve tickets at the train station. So you do not have to wait in line outside. Avoid Sundays it was very crowded. Breakfast is included in the room price. The beds were incredible after walking and touring all day. Hotel was very clean. I had no problem with alarms or service. This was the most accomidating french hotel that we have ever stayed at. It is not the san regis or the four seasons. Is why I rated it accordingly.
Reviews.Author: skiingutah

Reviews.Content: For the best sleep of your life Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights ... brilliant hotel in all respects ... the bed was sooooo comfortable .... and the little touches like a small teddy you find on your bed, the basket of fruit and the general layout of the room , was very sweet. The breakfast was again excellent with a wide variety of food and drink items. Most importantly, the location was brilliant ... literally 2 minutes away from champs ellesyes main road ... it takes time getting used to the streets but once you find a short cut, its great ... do get a 2 day pass as it allows unlimited access, but expect worse tubes than london ... best to travel by taxis after 2 as you see alot of yobs on the road ... also if you are not an earl grey or assam fan, take your own tea bags ... the room has CD facility so take your own music ... did not find french food very appetising but there is always macdonalds to rescue; do sit down at the cafes which are open till 2am, especially the hagen daz place; buddha bar is a must to see ... you have to book in reserve ... there is a man ray bar but nothing special ... drinks are very expensive so do save up ... if going for a weekend trip, dont leave your shopping till sunday as we did ... eiffel tower should only be seen at night ... go around 10 as it takes 2 hours to get to the top and admission closes at 11 ... the tower lights up every hour ... musuems, too many so be selective, the museum of louvre was interesting with mona lisa stuck in her tiny frame ... saw the most beautiful church (based behind the place where napoleon's body rest ... dont remember the name of the church but a must see) ...
Reviews.Author: Jitty

Reviews.Content: Wonderful in Every Way! We recently stayed at the Sofitel Arc de Triomphe during a business/pleasure trip to France. It was wonderful! The staff was very gracious ... the room large ... the bed heavenly ... the bathroom brightly lit and spacious. Our room overlooked the residential street. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood very close to the Champs Elysee and the beautiful Parc Monceau. Each was less than a five minute walk away. The hotel is very convenient to the metro and to the charming bistros south of the Champs. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Paris.
Reviews.Author: hpliz

Reviews.Content: Great location in the 8th - Lovely Hotel The hotel provided top-notch service, clean room and a great location. As a first time tourist in Paris, it was key to be so close to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysse. I would highly recommend this hotel.
